alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 4:25AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Camden and northeastern Currituck Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 424 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Indiantown, or 7 miles south of Currituck, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Grandy around 430 AM EDT. Corolla around 435 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Jarvisburg, Barco, Coinjock, Riddle, Poplar Branch, Aydlett, Waterlily, Bertha, Goose Creek and Maple. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
